summary: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, Congress dramatically increased the amount of loans, grants, and other financial assistance available from the Small Business Administration. SBA received about $3.4 billion in FY 2020 to administer this assistance. That is about 7 times what SBA typically receives for administration. SBA had spent about half of this money as of January 2021. It reported hiring over 6,000 temporary...
title: Small Business Administration: Use of Supplemental Funds for Administering COVID-19-Related Programs
